metadata.name: Is this role being posted for the immigration team?

title: HRIS Senior Solutions Manager
content:
Chewy is looking for an HRIS Sr. Solution Manager to join our HR Operations Team. In this role, you will be the Workday Configuration and Support subject matter expert, including HCM, Business Process, Security, Talent & Performance, Benefits, and Compensation. This role will support and drive the implementation of new functionality and enhancements by understanding end-user needs, developing business and functional requirements, building streamlined and effective processes, and supporting technical design, testing, and deployment to provide a best-in-class user experience.
You will partner across functional business teams, translating complex business needs to practical solution design recommendations, ensuring data, configuration, and security meet requirements. This role will leverage your deep functional expertise to understand process and systems requirements and contribute to the development, testing, and deployment activities for HCM technology as part of the HRIS team.
 
What You’ll Do:

Define and shape the business process architecture within your defined areas of responsibility
Act as the primary authority on HRIS configurations within a defined area(s) of responsibility, combining expert-level proficiency in the systems and solutions with an understanding of the functional HR processes
Communicate clearly and collaborate with stakeholders to turn broad requirements into recommended solutions and deliverables
Support feature releases and issue resolution, working with business users, IT, vendors, and other support teams to define scope, prioritize, plan, and implement system changes and enhancements
Document requirements and technical specifications to support our solution landscape and HR organizational needs for systems implementation, upgrades, and process improvements
Develop project plans using data gathered, constraints, and probable consequences, ensuring adherence to project schedule and other specifications
Manage project deliverables and milestones and specified project tasks
Identify test scenarios, develop test scripts, and provide essential support in Systems Integration Testing (SIT)
Work directly with stakeholders to identify, analyze, design, test, and implement new solutions or improvements to existing solutions
Help review communication and training materials in support of system navigation and changes, ensuring technical accuracy and assisting where necessary to develop 
Conduct high-level needs analysis and recommend service improvements to increase the efficiency of the systems
Develop and maintain awareness of the payroll industry to ensure compliance with policies and procedures
Participate in scheduled and ad hoc training to improve policy and process acumen
Mentor team by providing guidance, allowing them to learn new skills and functional areas

 
What You’ll Need:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field or equivalent experience
5+ Years of Workday experience, including a deep knowledge of the Workday core HCM, Advanced Compensation, or Talent Management, a plus
Workday certifications preferred
Knowledge of downstream integrations with the ability to gauge the impact of changes, triage, and remedy incidents and/or scope level of effort for new initiatives
Excellent communication and organizational skills, including the ability to translate between technical and business groups, bringing forward a vision or opinion
Demonstrated attention to detail and accuracy with the ability to design and develop solutions to meet business needs creatively
Comfort with leading multiple tasks and projects simultaneously and ability to prioritize decisions and tasks effectively to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Expertise in agile software development methodologies and their adoption within teams
Experience implementing complex HR systems such as Workday (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Success Factors)
The utmost passion for both technology and leadership
Customer Service-focused approach to interactions with business partners and employee user community
Travel expectation is approximately 10%

 Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you need an accommodation during the application process or to perform these job requirements, or if you need a religious accommodation, please contact CAAR@chewy.com.
 
If you have a question regarding your application, please contact HR@chewy.com.
 
To access Chewy's Customer Privacy Policy, please click here. To access Chewy's California CPRA Job Applicant Privacy Policy, please click here.

Arbitration Agreement Signed?
Arbitration Agreement Signed Date

Deloitte is Chewy’s independent auditor. To not impair Deloitte's independence, Chewy must validate the role of any current or former Deloitte employee against any exempt role they are interviewing for at Chewy. Do you currently work for Deloitte or have you ever been employed by Deloitte in the past?

Close family ties to a Deloitte employee could also impair Deloitte’s independence as Chewy’s auditor should you become employed by Chewy.  Do you have a close family member (spouse or equivalent, parent, dependent, non-dependent child, and/or sibling) that currently works for Deloitte?
